intro: Lepidagathis pavala, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pale green to yellow flowers, which are typically borne in dense, spike-like inflorescences. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Lepidagathis pavala is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its natural habitat.
